quote.#text: National Asthma and Allergy Awareness Month

official-title.#text: Expressing support for designation of May as

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

quote.#text: National Asthma and Allergy Awareness Month

text.#text:
encourages awareness of the prevalence of asthma and allergies, including heightened prevalence
			 among women, minority, and urban demographics;

recognizes and salutes health care professionals who treat asthma and allergy-related health
			 issues;
recognizes and salutes researchers working to identify asthma and allergy cures;

recognizes and reaffirms commitment to public education about asthma and allergy treatment and
			 symptoms and to advancing care for both asthma and allergy conditions; and
supports investment in researching the prevention, treatment, and eradication of asthma.

Whereas 7,100,000, or 9.5 percent, of children in the United States currently have asthma, and that
			 percentage has risen steadily since the 1980s;

Whereas 25,000,000, or 1 in 12, people in the United States have asthma, and the numbers are
			 increasing each year;

Whereas on average, in 2008 children missed 4 days of school and adults missed 5 days of work
			 because of asthma;
Whereas asthma is the most common noncommunicable disease among children;
Whereas 1,800,000 individuals per year visit emergency departments because of asthma’s effects;

Whereas asthma costs the United States about $3,300 in medical expenses per person with asthma each
			 year from 2002 to 2007;

Whereas medical expenses associated with asthma increased from $48,600,000,000 in 2002 to
			 $50,100,000,000 in 2007;

Whereas fewer than half of people with asthma report being taught how to avoid triggers, which are
			 key to the prevention of asthma attacks;
Whereas asthma is a manageable disease; and

quote.#text: National Asthma and Allergy Awareness Month

text.#text: Whereas May would be an appropriate month to designate as

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 563 IH: Expressing support for designation of May as “National Asthma and Allergy Awareness Month”.
